Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling of a very uncommon grape for California is dedicated to the late vintner Ron Siletto. Intense aromas of fresh currant and cranberry kick off the nose, while the palate shows snappy strawberry and white pepper flavors, leading into a minty finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Adroît 2020 Tres Pinos Aglianico (San Benito County)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: A censer is a vessel used for burning incense, typically in religious ceremonies. It is a perfect name for this wine given its transcendent nature. Aromas and flavors of cherries, violets, wet rattan and the contents of a schoolhouse chalk tray encircle your head and psyche. It has a massive tannic structure.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Vinous Obscura 2021 “Censer” Sagrantino (Columbia Gorge (OR))Editors' Choice

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wild and funky wine is a joy. Aromas suggest watermelon juice, game and dried roses. The palate is similar to a sour beer but livelier, with tart wild berries and an earthy finish.                      Jeff Porter
Name: Medici Ermete 2021 Phermento Lambrusco Rifermentato in Bottiglia  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Baked black plum, toasted wood and fennel-pollen aromas decorate the nose on this bottling of a promising grape for this region. Charred wood leads the palate, where roasted cherry and boysenberry converge for a bold expression.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Renzoni 2019 Montepulciano (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Lovely strawberry aromas are dusted in cinnamon bark and sandalwood on the dynamic nose of this bottling. Zesty cherry flavors ride a lingering acidity on the palate, as licorice adds a touch of spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Europa Village 2018 Vienza Montepulciano (Temecula Valley)
